project_abstract.cdata: The project is intended to increase total cattle numbers and herd productivity through on-farm investment and improvements in animal husbandry, nutrition and health. About 350 beef ranchers and approximately 225 dairy farmers are expected to participate. The loans would be used for pasture establishment, fencing, watering facilities, yards and dips, machinery, improved breeding stock, and other related inputs. Other components include (a) a research and training program for beef production, (b) a seed production and certification program, (c) assistance for modernizing the operations of the NDB, and (d) technical assistance for project administration.
